results.title: Magnetism
results.creator_credit: Dennis Tupicoff, Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Paul Vincent
results.brief_description: An animation that bleakly looks at love. When a couple meet and lay eyes on each other in a bar it’s instant attraction. Locked into an endless embrace (and locked in chains) with magnets abounding to symbolise the courtship, the relationship dramatically ends. The magnets are seen to disappear and join a graveyard of other magnets, a graveyard of lost love.

results.title: Magnetic fields and electric currents. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Films and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film investigates what happens when magnetic fields interact. The effect is studied by observing the magnetic fields of permanent magnets. Similar effects are shown to occur when the interacting fields are produced by electric currents. The principles demonstrated are used to explain the operation of a simple electric motor.

results.title: Magnaphonic 35mm projector
results.material_description:
C&W Sydney
Magna Coustian Pty ltd
41 Riley Street, Sydney

Magnaphonic full range sound system
manufactured by:
Magna Coustian Pty ltd
41 Riley Street, Sydney
Phone FL 1322
Phone FL 2554

ID. 8077
The British Thomson, Houston Co.  Ltd
Rugby, England (Made in England)
A.C. Motor
Type BKS 2408
HP 1/4
R.P.M: 1425
Volts 240/250
Cycles 50
Phase 1
Rating: Continuous
Cat no. D877416

The top case has a blue plastic reel with film inside it.
The bottom case has a red plastic reel inside it.
There is an orange rubber power cord nestled and rolled up in the middle of the unit.

Adjustments:  there is black duct tape holding in place a small box.  The unit has very much been modified by the previous owner.

Condition:
The rubber belt has begun to erode and crack, the belt behind that has also begun to erode.
There is black paint flecking away, particularly towards to top.
results.brief_description: One of two magnaphonic 35mm projectors donated by Bill Newman. Kerri’s father (name to be confirmed) has taken the projectors apart, cleaned them and re-assembled them. He has also repainted the lamp houses. Representative of early twentieth century Australian cinema equipment and history. These projectors were operated in Tumbarumba NSW, by William James Burnell Newman (Bill), who operated under Valley Theatres, from approximately 1959 until 1965, when TV started the demise of country theatres. These projectors were used in tandem as film rolls needed to be changed seamlessly during a session. The projectionist loaded all ‘even’ reels on one projector, and ‘odd’ reels on the other projector. As a reel was nearing its end, the projectionist had to switch over the film with perfect timing.

results.title: Magical mystery tour
results.creator_credit: Beatles, George Harrison, Bernard Knowles, John Lennon, Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr
results.brief_description: Join The Beatles on an hallucinatory mystery tour to the tunes of “Baby your a rich man”, “Penny lane”, “Flying”, “The Fool on the hill”, “All you need is love”, “Strawberry fields forever”, “Blue jay way”, “Hello goodbye”, “I am the walrus”, “Your mother should know”, and “All my loving”.

results.title: Magic: an insiders view (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: Comedian, television personality and magician Harry Anderson exposes the techniques magicians have kept secret for years. You have the choice of viewing the trick from three different camera angles, increasing the odds of the viewer being able to perform the trick themselves. This interactive CD-ROM also cover the history, lore and intrigue of the mystery that is magic. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS for Windows 486/33 PC or compatible with hard disk drive, Microsoft Windows 3.1, 8MB RAM, 5MB free hard disk space, 256-color or higher graphics card, 14” SVGA monitor, double speed CD-ROM drive, MPC-compatible sound card and speakers, keyboard and mouse, SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS for Macintosh with 25-MHz 68030 processor or better, Systme 7 or gigher, 8MB RAM, 5MB free hard disk space, 13” monitor, 256 colors, double-speed CD-ROM drive.

results.title: Magic Orchard
results.brief_description: Animated oriental fairy tale. A drought stricken village incurs further suffering when it is attacked by bandits. However, their luck changes when they find a pot of gold. The gold is used to buy some caged birds which, when set free, return to the village with seeds, from which grow a magic orchard. The orchard brings prosperity to the village, and its magic protects them from the bandits. (No narration or dialogue.)

results.title: Magic of the mountains: summer and autumn
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: Kashmir, the summer playground of ancient kings and now a holiday resort. Formal Mogul gardens with fountains; flowers; work in papiermache and embroidery; life around the lakes; sports; trips into the mountains; the shepherds; autumn, harvest and fruit picking; the coming of winter.

results.title: Magic of nature. No. 3. The Ladybird
results.brief_description: Aphids, one of the most common and destructive garden pests, do much damage each spring to growing plants. Their enemy is the tiny carniverous ladybird which consumes them in large numbers. The film, using close-up photography, records the 8-week life span of the ladybird.
